result.execSummary:
All charges against Christopher L Pipkorn in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher L Pipkorn is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc:
*Dismissed without prejudice.
 *The defendant has satisfied the requirement of the plea offer in this matter by paying upfront restitution in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher L Pipkorn

Order of Dismissal /s/ LJM 10/12/22 
*Dismissed without prejudice.
 *The defendant has satisfied the requirement of the plea offer in this matter by paying upfront restitution in full.
Order of Dismissal filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 10/11/22 sp)
Motion to Dismiss filed by the State (sent to Br 2 Judge on 10/11/22 sp)
Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:49 PM Defendant Christopher L Pipkorn in court.  Attorney Jared Redfield in court for Christopher L Pipkorn.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Exhibit #P1 is marked for ADA Jambois.
3:50 p.m.  Patrol Officer J Anderson is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Jambois.
3:52 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
BY THE COURT: 
Record will reflect that the witness has identified the defendant.
3:53 p.m.  ADA Jambois references exhibit #P1.
3:54 p.m.  ADA Jambois offers exhibit #P1 into evidence, subject to cross examination.   No objection by Atty Redfield.  Received by the Court.
Cross examination by Atty Redfield.
4:02 p.m.  ADA Jambois has no additional questions and no additional witnesses.
Witness is excused.
Atty Redfield has no witnesses.
Neither party gives a final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Atty Jared Redfield

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ LJM 08/18/22
DENIED:  The person is not indigent
Mailed to the defendant on 08/18/22 sp (attempted to contact by phone but just rang and no voicemail)

9:01 AM 
Defendant Christopher L Pipkorn in court, pro se.
Court calls the case and states appearances.
Matter is set for an indigency hearing - defendant requesting a court-appointed attorney.

Defendant is sworn in by the clerk.
Court questions the witness.
Court reviews the public defender eligibility form and refers to it during questioning.
Court calculates the defendant's income and expenses.
Court continues questioning the defendant.

Court states findings.

BY THE COURT:
Petition for court appointed attorney is denied.

Court indicates that the defendant should try to find a private attorney.
If he is unable to find one, he can come back and the court will reevaluate the situation.
Indigency hearing on August 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
